page.title: 05Dairy Farming at Manor Farm
page.content: The farm has 7 fields for cows. Cows give 4 gallons of milk each every day. The cows are milked twice a day, morning and evening. The farmer buys Friesian cows from Congleton Market. He keeps the cows for 8 years until they stop giving so much milk. Then he sells his cows at Chelford Market. The farmer has 60 cows altogether. The cows give 190 gallons of milk every day. The farmer gives them silage and corn and straw to eat. They need to have a calf every year and then they will give milk for 10 months. The farmer puts red tape on the tails of the cows which are resting, before they have their next calf .
